headline.main: Pre-Islam Idols Being Broken Under Decree By Afghans

lead_paragraph: Ignoring an international outcry, the Islamic Taliban government began demolishing statues across the country today, including two ancient stone Buddhas, to prevent the worship of ''false idols.'' An edict announced Monday by the Taliban's supreme leader, Mullah Muhammad Omar, called for the destruction of all statues in a strict interpretation of Islamic law banning idols.
abstract: Taliban government, ignoring international outcry, begins demolishing statues across Afghanistan, including two ancient stone Buddhas, to prevent worship of 'false idols' in strict interpretration of Islamic law; appeals for preservation have come from dozen countries and from United Nations Sec Gen Kofi Annan (M)
